Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) to the atmosphere
comment: Net emissions 'Emissions|CO2' = 'Gross Emissions|CO2' + 'Gross Removals|CO2'. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.
internal_comment: mapping taken from NAVIGATE, NAVIGATE category: emissions (non-CO2)

description: Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3), including agricultural emissions from livestock, rice cultivation and soil management as well as emissions from land use and land-use change such as deforestation, conversion of non-forest natural land, and drained peatlands
comment: This variable reports the sum of sources and sinks including land-use methods such as soil carbon sequestration, biochar, forestry, and re/afforestation and agroforestry. It uses the model/scientific definition of AFOLU, and does not align with the reporting of national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI). For NGHGI-aligned reporting, see 'Emissions|*|AFOLU [NGHGI]'. Emissions reported in this category represent fluxes to/from the atmosphere from/to the land pool. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.
internal_comment: mapping taken from NAVIGATE, NAVIGATE category: emissions (non-CO2)

description: Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3) in line with the national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI)
comment: This variable is optional, for instance used for comparison with national greenhouse gas inventories, but is not used for driving climate model simulations, and also not a component of 'Emissions|*', for which the variable 'Emissions|*|AFOLU' with a model/scientific definition is used.
internal_comment: not represented

description: Emissions from agricultural waste burning (IPCC 1996 category 4F - partially IPCC 2006 category 3C1)
comment: Also sometimes known as 'biomass burning' or 'open agricultural burning'
internal_comment: added manually

description: Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from the agriculture sector (IPCC 1996 category 4 - IPCC 2006 category 3A and 3C except 3C1)
internal_comment: mapping taken from AR6

description: Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from livestock in the agriculture sector (IPCC 1996 category 4A and 4B - IPCC 2006 category 3A)
Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from enteric fermentation of livestock (IPCC 1996 category 4A - IPCC 2006 category 3A1) in the agriculture sector
Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from processes involving manure (waste) management in Livestock in the agriculture sector (IPCC 1996 category 4B - IPCC 2006 category 3A2)
Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from soil management practices in the agriculture sector (IPCC 1996 category 4D - IPCC 2006 category 3C4 and 3C5)
Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from rice cultivation (IPCC 1996 category 4C - IPCC 2006 category 3C7)

Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from forestry and other land use and land use change. Removals in this variable include agroforestry, re/afforestation, biochar, soil carbon management and forest management.
internal_comment: added manually

description: Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from forestry and other land use and land use change. Removals in this variable include agroforestry, re/afforestation, biochar, soil carbon management and forest management.
internal_comment: added manually

description: Emissions from land fires and deforestation & degradation fires
internal_comment: added manually

description: Emissions from land fires and deforestation & degradation fires
internal_comment: added manually

description: Emissions from boreal forest fires, temperate forest fires, and tropical deforestation & degradation fires
internal_comment: added manually

description: Emissions from savanna, grassland, and shrubland fires
internal_comment: added manually

description: Emissions from peat fires
internal_comment: not represented

description: Emissions and removals from harvested wood products (HWP) (no clear IPCC 1996 category - IPCC 2006 category 3D1)

Emissions and removals from forest land, cropland, grassland, settlements and other natural land (partially IPCC 1996 category 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3B except 3B1biii, 3B2biii, 3B3biii, 3B5biv, 3B6biv and 3B4).
comment: This variable only includes anthropogenic emissions, but does not include emissions from managed or rewetted wetlands.

description: Emissions and removals from land that cannot be  accommodated in other categories (no clear IPCC 1996 category - IPCC 2006 category 3D2)

Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from managed wetlands (e.g., peatland), including emissions from drained wetlands used for agriculture, forestry or other uses (IPCC 2006 categories 3B1biii, 3B2biii and 3B3biii, 3B5biv, 3B6biv), and emissions from rewetted wetlands (IPCC 2006 category 3B4)
comment: Includes reservoirs as a managed sub-division and natural rivers and lakes as unmanaged sub-divisions. Includes drained and rewetted wetlands, does not include natural emissions from intact wetlands.

description: Emissions of carbon dioxide (CO2) from energy use, including fugitive emissions from fuels (IPCC category 1A (except manufacturing 1A2 and other unspecified 1A5), 1B), reporting the sum of sources and sinks, including negative emissions from carbon capture and removal using BECCS and other forms of CCS on energy supply and demand for instance for Oil, Gas, and Coal, as well as bio-oil storage and synthetic fuels
comment: For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.
internal_comment: mapping taken from NAVIGATE, NAVIGATE category: emissions (non-CO2)

description: Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from energy use in supply and demand sectors (IPCC category 1A, 1B) and from industrial processes (IPCC categories 1A2, 1A5, 2A, 2B, 2C, 2E), including emissions from international bunker fuels. This is the sum of sources and sinks, and includes negative emisisons in these sectors, for instance from bioenergy with CCS (BECCS)
comment: For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.
internal_comment: added manually

description: Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from fuel combustion in industry (IPCC category 1A2), residential, commercial, institutional sectors and agriculture, forestry, fishing (AFOFI) (IPCC category 1A4a, 1A4b, 1A4c), and the transportation sector (IPCC category 1A3), excluding pipeline emissions (IPCC category 1A3ei). This is the sum of sources and sinks, including negative emissions such as the demand-side use of bioenergy with CCS (BECCS)
internal_comment: added manually

description: Emissions of black carbon (soot, BC) from fuel combustion in industry (IPCC category 1A2), residential, commercial, institutional sectors and agriculture, forestry, fishing (AFOFI) (IPCC category 1A4a, 1A4b, 1A4c), and the transportation sector (IPCC category 1A3), excluding pipeline emissions (IPCC category 1A3ei). description: Emissions of C2F6 from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3), including agricultural emissions from livestock, rice cultivation and soil management as well as emissions from land use and land-use change such as deforestation, conversion of non-forest natural land, and drained peatlands
comment: This variable reports the sum of sources and sinks including land-use methods such as soil carbon sequestration, biochar, forestry, and re/afforestation and agroforestry. It uses the model/scientific definition of AFOLU, and does not align with the reporting of national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI). For NGHGI-aligned reporting, see 'Emissions|*|AFOLU [NGHGI]'. Emissions reported in this category represent fluxes to/from the atmosphere from/to the land pool. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.

description: Emissions of C2F6 from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3) in line with the national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI)

description: Capture and removal of atmospheric methane (CH4) using other net-negative technologies that are not directly linked to an emissions source, including direct air carbon capture and storage (DACCS) or enhanced weathering (EW), as well as durable wood products in building elements or plastics, mineral products, ocean fertilization, ocean alkalinity enhancement (OAE), and direct ocean capture.
comment: This timeseries should be reported as negative values so that subcategories of emissions add up to net emissions 'Emissions|CH4'. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.

description: Emissions of carbon dioxide (CO2) from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3), including agricultural emissions from livestock, rice cultivation and soil management as well as emissions from land use and land-use change such as deforestation, conversion of non-forest natural land, and drained peatlands
comment: This variable reports the sum of sources and sinks including land-use methods such as soil carbon sequestration, biochar, forestry, and re/afforestation and agroforestry. It uses the model/scientific definition of AFOLU, and does not align with the reporting of national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI). For NGHGI-aligned reporting, see 'Emissions|*|AFOLU [NGHGI]'. Emissions reported in this category represent fluxes to/from the atmosphere from/to the land pool. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.
internal_comment: mapping taken from NAVIGATE, using REMIND variable but checking consistency with MAgPIE variables via summation check

description: Emissions of carbon dioxide (CO2) from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3) in line with the national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI)
comment: This variable is optional, for instance used for comparison with national greenhouse gas inventories, but is not used for driving climate model simulations, and also not a component of 'Emissions|*', for which the variable 'Emissions|*|AFOLU' with a model/scientific definition is used.

Emissions of carbon monoxide (CO) from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3), including agricultural emissions from livestock, rice cultivation and soil management as well as emissions from land use and land-use change such as deforestation, conversion of non-forest natural land, and drained peatlands
comment: This variable reports the sum of sources and sinks including land-use methods such as soil carbon sequestration, biochar, forestry, and re/afforestation and agroforestry. It uses the model/scientific definition of AFOLU, and does not align with the reporting of national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI). For NGHGI-aligned reporting, see 'Emissions|*|AFOLU [NGHGI]'. Emissions reported in this category represent fluxes to/from the atmosphere from/to the land pool. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.

description: Emissions of Kyoto GHG emissions, including CO2, CH4, N2O and F-gases from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3), including agricultural emissions from livestock, rice cultivation and soil management as well as emissions from land use and land-use change such as deforestation, conversion of non-forest natural land, and drained peatlands
comment: This variable reports the sum of sources and sinks including land-use methods such as soil carbon sequestration, biochar, forestry, and re/afforestation and agroforestry. It uses the model/scientific definition of AFOLU, and does not align with the reporting of national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI). For NGHGI-aligned reporting, see 'Emissions|*|AFOLU [NGHGI]'. Emissions reported in this category represent fluxes to/from the atmosphere from/to the land pool. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.
internal_comment: mapping taken from NAVIGATE, NAVIGATE category: emissions (non-CO2)

description: Emissions of Kyoto GHG emissions, including CO2, CH4, N2O and F-gases from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3) in line with the national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI)
comment: This variable is optional, for instance used for comparison with national greenhouse gas inventories, but is not used for driving climate model simulations, and also not a component of 'Emissions|*', for which the variable 'Emissions|*|AFOLU' with a model/scientific definition is used.

description: Emissions of ammonium (NH3) from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3), including agricultural emissions from livestock, rice cultivation and soil management as well as emissions from land use and land-use change such as deforestation, conversion of non-forest natural land, and drained peatlands
comment: This variable reports the sum of sources and sinks including land-use methods such as soil carbon sequestration, biochar, forestry, and re/afforestation and agroforestry. It uses the model/scientific definition of AFOLU, and does not align with the reporting of national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI). For NGHGI-aligned reporting, see 'Emissions|*|AFOLU [NGHGI]'. Emissions reported in this category represent fluxes to/from the atmosphere from/to the land pool. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.

description: Emissions of nitrous oxides (NOx) from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3), including agricultural emissions from livestock, rice cultivation and soil management as well as emissions from land use and land-use change such as deforestation, conversion of non-forest natural land, and drained peatlands
comment: This variable reports the sum of sources and sinks including land-use methods such as soil carbon sequestration, biochar, forestry, and re/afforestation and agroforestry. It uses the model/scientific definition of AFOLU, and does not align with the reporting of national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI). For NGHGI-aligned reporting, see 'Emissions|*|AFOLU [NGHGI]'. Emissions reported in this category represent fluxes to/from the atmosphere from/to the land pool. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.
internal_comment: mapping taken from NAVIGATE, NAVIGATE category: emissions (non-CO2)

description: Emissions of organic compound from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3), including agricultural emissions from livestock, rice cultivation and soil management as well as emissions from land use and land-use change such as deforestation, conversion of non-forest natural land, and drained peatlands
comment: This variable reports the sum of sources and sinks including land-use methods such as soil carbon sequestration, biochar, forestry, and re/afforestation and agroforestry. It uses the model/scientific definition of AFOLU, and does not align with the reporting of national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI). For NGHGI-aligned reporting, see 'Emissions|*|AFOLU [NGHGI]'. Emissions reported in this category represent fluxes to/from the atmosphere from/to the land pool. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.

description: Emissions of volatile organic compound from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC 1996 category 4, 5 - IPCC 2006 category 3), including agricultural emissions from livestock, rice cultivation and soil management as well as emissions from land use and land-use change such as deforestation, conversion of non-forest natural land, and drained peatlands
comment: This variable reports the sum of sources and sinks including land-use methods such as soil carbon sequestration, biochar, forestry, and re/afforestation and agroforestry. It uses the model/scientific definition of AFOLU, and does not align with the reporting of national greenhouse gas inventories (NGHGI). For NGHGI-aligned reporting, see 'Emissions|*|AFOLU [NGHGI]'. Emissions reported in this category represent fluxes to/from the atmosphere from/to the land pool. For a breakdown of carbon removals, see the 'Carbon Removal|*' variables.
internal_comment: mapping taken from NAVIGATE, NAVIGATE category: emissions (non-CO2)

Terrestrial biodiversity measured with Biodiversity Intactness Index (BII)
comment: The Biodiversity Intactness Index (BII) summarises the change in ecological communities in response to human pressures. The BII is an estimated percentage of the original number of species that remain and their abundance in any given area, despite human impacts. The main difference between MSA and BII is that every unit of land is given equal weight in MSA, whereas BII gives more weight to species-rich areas.

description: Terrestrial biodiversity measured in Mean Species Abundance (MSA)
comment: An indicator of naturalness or biodiversity intactness. It is defined as the mean abundance of original species relative to their abundance in undisturbed ecosystems. An MSA (Mean Species Abundance) of 0 % means a completely destructed ecosystem, with no original species remaining. An MSA of 100 % indicates an undisturbed ecosystem, in which species abundance is comparable to the natural state.

description: Terrestrial biodiversity of plant species measured in Mean Species Abundance (MSA)
comment: An indicator of naturalness or biodiversity intactness. It is defined as the mean abundance of original species relative to their abundance in undisturbed ecosystems. An MSA (Mean Species Abundance) of 0 % means a completely destructed ecosystem, with no original species remaining. An MSA of 100 % indicates an undisturbed ecosystem, in which species abundance is comparable to the natural state.

description: Terrestrial biodiversity of vertebrate species measured in Mean Species Abundance (MSA)
comment: An indicator of naturalness or biodiversity intactness. It is defined as the mean abundance of original species relative to their abundance in undisturbed ecosystems. An MSA (Mean Species Abundance) of 0 % means a completely destructed ecosystem, with no original species remaining. An MSA of 100 % indicates an undisturbed ecosystem, in which species abundance is comparable to the natural state.

description: Crop diversity measured by the Shannon index accounting for crop richness and abundance
comment: The Shannon index is a an index of crop diversity. Both the number of species and their distribution are included in the calculation. Higher values indicate higher crop diversity. Typical values generally range between 1.5 and 3.5.
